article.headline: Central Florida 64, Belmont 62
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Dexter Lyons scored 27 points, including two clutch free throws as the game came to a close, to lead Central Florida to a 64-62 win over Belmont in the Atlantic Sun Tournament Friday night. The Golden Knights (24-5) advance to face Troy State in the championship game at Saturday, with the winner receiving the conference's automatic bid to the NCAA Tournament. Belmont (21-8) had two chances to tie the game on final trip downcourt, but Brian Collins missed a layup with four seconds to play, and following an in-bounds play, Josh Goodwin's turnaround shot underneath the basket fell short just before the buzzer sounded. Lyons made 10 of 17 shots from the floor, including 4-of-6 three pointers for Central Florida. Josh Bodden added 19 points for the Golden Knights, who rallied from a 34-29 halftime deficit to claim the victory. Steve Drabyn led the Bruins with 21 points, including 5-of-11 3-pointers. Adam Mark finished with 11 points for Belmont, 10 in the second half. Central Florida held a 34-25 advantage on the boards against the smaller Bruins.
